title: Value Premises and Criteria in Lincoln-Douglas Debate

questions.question: What is a value premise in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: A factual statement that supports an argument
The core ethical or moral concept prioritized in evaluating the resolution
A statistical data point used to prove a claim
The conclusion of a logical syllogism
questions.answer: The core ethical or moral concept prioritized in evaluating the resolution

questions.question: What is the primary function of a criterion in Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: To provide evidence for arguments
To measure how well a side upholds the value premise
To define the terms of the resolution
To establish the time limits for speeches
questions.answer: To measure how well a side upholds the value premise

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between value premises and criteria?
choices: Criteria are used to support and measure value premises
Value premises are used to justify criteria
They are interchangeable terms in debate
Criteria are always more important than value premises
questions.answer: Criteria are used to support and measure value premises

questions.question: Why is it important to connect values to the Timorese cultural context in this course?
choices: To make the debate more entertaining
To simplify complex issues
To make the debate relevant and meaningful to Timorese students
To avoid discussing controversial topics
questions.answer: To make the debate relevant and meaningful to Timorese students

questions.question: What is a moral framework in the context of Lincoln-Douglas debate?
choices: A list of rules for proper debate etiquette
A system of ethical principles used to guide decision-making
A scoring system for judging debates
A method for organizing debate notes
questions.answer: A system of ethical principles used to guide decision-making

questions.question: How should students approach selecting a value premise for a debate?
choices: Choose the most complex value to impress the judge
Select a value that is easy to define but hard to measure
Pick a value that aligns with the resolution and can be supported with criteria
Use the same value premise for every debate to maintain consistency
questions.answer: Pick a value that aligns with the resolution and can be supported with criteria

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Values Auction' warm-up activity?
choices: To teach students about economics
To identify which values students consider most important
To practice math skills
To simulate a real auction experience
questions.answer: To identify which values students consider most important

questions.question: In the context of Lincoln-Douglas debate, what is an ethical standard?
choices: A rule for proper behavior during a debate
A principle used to judge the rightness or wrongness of actions or policies
A measure of a debater's honesty
A guideline for selecting debate topics
questions.answer: A principle used to judge the rightness or wrongness of actions or policies

questions.question: Why is it important to brainstorm Timorese values in this lesson?
choices: To compare Timorese values with Western values
To create a list of topics for future debates
To understand and incorporate local context into debate arguments
To practice spelling Timorese words
questions.answer: To understand and incorporate local context into debate arguments

questions.question: What is the purpose of the production task in the lesson plan?
choices: To practice public speaking skills
To apply the concepts of value premises and criteria to a specific resolution
To learn about Timorese history
To prepare for a formal debate competition
questions.answer: To apply the concepts of value premises and criteria to a specific resolution

questions.question: How does cultural context influence the selection of value premises and criteria?
choices: It doesn't; value premises and criteria are universal
It determines which values are considered important in a given society
It only affects the way arguments are presented, not their content
It is irrelevant to Lincoln-Douglas debate
questions.answer: It determines which values are considered important in a given society

questions.question: What is the benefit of having students develop criteria for Timorese values?
choices: It improves their language skills
It helps them understand how to measure and apply values in debate
It prepares them for international debate competitions
It teaches them about Timorese law
questions.answer: It helps them understand how to measure and apply values in debate

questions.question: Why might a debater choose 'justice' as a value premise?
choices: Because it's easy to define and everyone agrees on its meaning
Because it's a complex concept that can be applied to many resolutions
Because it's the only value allowed in Lincoln-Douglas debate
Because it guarantees winning the debate
questions.answer: Because it's a complex concept that can be applied to many resolutions

questions.question: What is the purpose of the homework assignment in this lesson?
choices: To prepare students for a test on Timorese culture
To encourage independent research and application of concepts
To improve students' writing skills
To create content for the next class debate
questions.answer: To encourage independent research and application of concepts

questions.question: How does the lesson plan address the connection between values and current issues in Timor-Leste?

Through the homework assignment asking students to apply a value-criterion pair to a current issue
By inviting guest speakers to discuss current issues
It doesn't address this connection

Critical thinking and argumentation
Public speaking
Note-taking

To impress judges with complex terminology
To create a coherent and measurable ethical framework for their arguments
To memorize a list of values and criteria
questions.answer: To create a coherent and measurable ethical framework for their arguments

A system for taking notes during a debate
A strategy for managing debate time
A technique for cross-examination

By having students present their value-criterion pairs to the class
By assigning speeches as homework
It doesn't address public speaking skills

To acknowledge and respect the cultural heritage of Timor-Leste
Because traditional values are always superior to modern ones
To avoid discussing controversial topics
